intro: Macrolobium canaliculatum var. canaliculatum, commonly known as the canoe plant, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It is characterized by its large, canoe-shaped leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in loose clusters, which bloom during the wet season. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread rapidly in waterlogged soils. It is often used in aquatic gardens and for erosion control in wetland areas.
